sen.e: Munemaro ISHIGURO (April 14, 1893 - June 3, 1968) was a ceramic artist from Kuguminato, Imizu City, Toyama Prefecture.

sen.j: 1918年（大正7年）中国宋 (王朝)の時代の陶器である曜変天目に惹かれ陶芸家を志した。
sen.e: In 1918, he was fascinated with Yohen Tenmoku, the ceramics from Sung, China, and aimed to be a ceramic artist.

sen.j: 戦後は著名になっても作品を多くは売らない作家として「「ぶっている」なんて風評が世間ではあるが僕は唯作るのに忙しく時間が無いだけです」と黙々と作陶生活をした。
sen.e: Although he became famous after the war, he continued making ceramics, selling little of his work; he put: "There is a rumor that I am acting like a 'Living National Treasure,' but it is just that I am very busy creating and thus have little time."
